intro: Erechtites pyrophilus, commonly known as the flameweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and full sun conditions. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Erechtites pyrophilus is also known for its resilience to fire, which contributes to its common name.
